Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
Check for a connection, generate our categories and buildings list from the database, and set up the grid layout of buttons.

createBuildingList

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> createBuildingList(java.util.HashMap<GeoPoint,Building> map)
Returns an ArrayList of unique buildings from a HashMap of GeoPoints and buildings.

createIconsList

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> createIconsList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> categories,
                                                                                    Context c)
Returns a map from categories to icons (icons must be the same lower-case string as the category) Populates the HashMap with both small icons and bigger icons. Key for small icons: "" Key for big icons: "-big"

getBigIcon

public static java.lang.Integer getBigIcon(java.lang.String category)
Returns a large-sized icon associated with the category These icons are used for the menu's grid buttons.

Parameters:
category - The top-level category
Returns:
If no icon is found, return the default Android icon. Otherwise, return the appropriate category icon.

getBuilding

public static Building getBuilding(GeoPoint point)
Returns the building associated with the GeoPoint

getBuildingsList

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getBuildingsList()
Returns an ArrayList of buildings

getCategoriesList

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCategoriesList()
Returns an ArrayList of top-level categories

getCategoriesList

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getCategoriesList(JSONArray listOfCategories)
Returns an ArrayList of categories, duplicated from the given JSONArray list. The list is almost exactly the same, with the exclusion of regions, floors, and exception of "school_supplies" (which is added as "supplies").

Parameters:
listOfCategories - List of categories, in JSONArray form.

getGeoPointFromBuilding

public static GeoPoint getGeoPointFromBuilding(java.lang.String buildingName)
Returns the GeoPoint associated with the building. Icon overlays are positioned on these GeoPoints.

Parameters:
buildingName - The full name of the building.
Returns:
GeoPoint representing the 'center' of the building.

getIcon

public static java.lang.Integer getIcon(java.lang.String category)
Returns a miniature-sized icon associated with the category These icons are used for the map overlays and dialog windows.

Parameters:
category - The top-level category
Returns:
If no icon is found, return the default Android icon. otherwise, return the appropriate category icon.

onCreateOptionsMenu

public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
Creates the Android options menu

onOptionsItemSelected

public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
Expand and define the Android options menu

onPrepareOptionsMenu

public boolean onPrepareOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
Prepares the options menu before being displayed. Removes redundant Category option, and centering location option (special for the Map only).
